definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash

sentences.english: After experiments, the cells should be washed entirely with drug-free buffer, ensuring that the cells return to natural condition.
sentences.chinese: 實驗完成後，要衝洗細胞，保證細胞恢復到正常狀態。

sentences.english: You should avoid swallowing pool water and shower before and after you swim.
sentences.chinese: 您應該避免喝下泳池內的水，游泳前後也都要衝澡。

sentences.english: First, Liangdaicun site locates in a very important traffic and strategic location from the northern china to central plain.
sentences.chinese: 第一，梁帶村位於北方世界至中原的南北交通要衝。

sentences.english: So you are about to rush in to save the child.
sentences.chinese: 就在要衝進池塘救人的時候。

sentences.english: The Strait of Malacca is one of the worlds hottest and most crucial strategic choke points.
sentences.chinese: 馬六甲海峽是世界上最危險和最重要的戰略要衝之一。

sentences.english: I declare! so the deacon's goin' to try his hand on Old Baldy, eh?
sentences.chinese: 我敢說，執事打算要衝老禿子下手了，嗯？

sentences.english: All the people had to rush to the guillotine save WangXiaoGong and MeiXianZu.
sentences.chinese: 衆百姓都要衝到斷頭臺上救下王小紅和梅賢祖。

definition: to garrison/to stand guard/on garrison duty
Changjiang 長江|长江 or Yangtze River/old name for Changjiang, especially lower reaches around Yangzhou 揚州|扬州
lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
relatives/members of the same family, clan, tribe etc
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
preparedness/to bring sth to a state of readiness
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
